extendedIngredients.name: cream
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cup BREAKSTONE'S or KNUDSEN Sour Cream

title: Fish with Romesco-Style Sauce
summary: Fish with Romesco-Style Sauce is a gluten free, primal, and pescatarian recipe with 40 servings. One serving contains 33 calories, 3g of protein, and 2g of fat. For 24 cents per serving, this recipe covers 2% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. If you have snapper fillets, parsley, roasted peppers, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 40 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 21%. This score is not so great. Try Fish parcels with romesco sauce & veg, Ginger-steamed Fish With Troy's Hana-style Sauce, and Dinner Tonight: Grilled Romesco-Style Pork for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 99 dollars.

productMatches.title: Zind-Humbrecht Clos Windsbuhl Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris

instructions: Pour dressing over fish in shallow dish; turn to evenly coat both sides of each fillet.  Refrigerate 20 min. to marinate.                                            Meanwhile, blend next 4 ingredients in blender until smooth; pour into bowl.  Stir in parsley.  Refrigerate until ready to use.                                            Heat large nonstick skillet on medium-high heat.  Remove fish from marinade; discard marinade.  Add fish to skillet; cook 6 min. on each side or until fish flakes easily with fork. Serve topped with sauce.

steps.step: Pour dressing over fish in shallow dish; turn to evenly coat both sides of each fillet.  Refrigerate 20 min. to marinate.
Meanwhile, blend next 4 ingredients in blender until smooth; pour into bowl.  Stir in parsley.  Refrigerate until ready to use.
Heat large nonstick skillet on medium-high heat.
Remove fish from marinade; discard marinade.
Add fish to skillet; cook 6 min. on each side or until fish flakes easily with fork.
